item.title: observe
item.description:
it appears in my dreams and nightmares, and is stitched five times onto the outer layer of my clothes

but it doesn’t feel like me, it’s dissociated from the wind and changing leaves outside my window

dancing dancing dancing around the issue, while the kettle boils over, in our imperceptably accelerating train

are symmetries boring, or the only interesting thing? it’s definitely one of the two. the proof is just like the irrationality of e + pi or e * pi

“there is a good chance things will get better after this year”

item.title: feel alive?
item.description:
one time in Oxford…

Hannah who I never met besides standing in a kiddy pool in the dolphin

Sam K who I know through honey

Tae-yeoun through MB, and Fleur and Kris and Sohin and Curtis

It’s an asymmetric feeling

wish I knew even a hint

what it meant

but her piano rang out beautifully for centuries that minute

it all moves so fast and slow

I want to be fifty

I want to be five

I just want to feel alive

item.title: last night in town
item.description:
a dark and sweet summer sadness
on my lips like the wine I can’t drink tomorrow

the pitchers of pimms helped me not to get too lost in the dusk
I ran through the perch portals afraid for my friends

it all happened so fast
painfully slowly in the dark
I never could have enjoyed it, no matter how hard I tried
and I really did try

sam, you really saved me

item.title: human beings
item.description:
we are gripped and released

by our interests and our lovers

by my math and my designs

i let them go, and i let her go

some things do come back

and i greet them like old friends

and solve the boundary value problem

constructing boundaries, wanting to form a cobordism

haha

sorry i make these kinds of jokes

it’s not that i’m hiding behind the formalism

i just have no idea what to say

item.title: myself
item.description:
marquez can write about salacious solitude

but mine isn’t so colorful, nor served with steaming heaps of rice and plantains

i think the moral keeps forgetting to kick in

someone tell god

news about trump and bombs in public places

distract me from my distractions

if the purpose of life is to hydrogenate carbon dioxide

no new functor is going to push (pull?) me out of this plantainless plane

sometimes i wish we didn’t understand things so well

item.title: all my friends
item.description:
on this evening at 7:16pm

lying in this bed with legs crossed

at 3010 15th street boulder colorado usa

i’m listening to that lcd soundsystem track

this month i saw clockwork orange in 35mm

with my best colorado friend

and i hiked sanitas

with my best pittsburgh friend

and talked at fairview

with my best connecticut friend

and drove to the west

with my best friend

but anyway, what i’m trying to say

always trying to say, over and over and over and over again

i love my friends

they’re my favorite part of living

people are the best, relativity is a close second

sam i’ll see you soon

please close this tab and never come back to this website

it isn’t meant to be anything

the stickers on the back of my phone

went beyond fading

their fabric is disintegrating

revealing the embarrassing past once again

another long goodbye

item.title: onwards
item.description:
the unspoken philosophy we presume of others

well sometimes it isn’t there

i talked to cathy for a long time about all the paths of life, she listened and commented the appropriate comments:

no, there is no truth out there

no, you’ll never know you’re on the right path

yes, you should think about what you’re doing
but no, not too hard

and time will pass, and life will happen
and somehow it will all continue
the way it’s been going for a million years
and you’ll eat food and drink drinks
and travel places and make friends
and have love and maybe kids

and so on and so forth
so enjoy the little things

ok!

item.title: fool
item.description:
i thought if i went far away, i could see everything more clearly. well, yes and no.

something that doesn’t interact with anything, doesn’t actually exist at all.

well i exist only half here, and half in england.

or maybe i don’t exist anywhere at all.

item.title: tired
item.description:
i remember waking up after a long night’s sleep, so so slowly. the alarm sound that could take me from a dream with perfect ease. maybe i went to sleep thinking about pacing the woods in grace.

the eastern sun through the southern windows couldn’t differentiate the pale beige walls from my skin. it was the eye of a storm that never came or went. walking around the second floor of the house, getting dressed, sending signals around to my waking limbs, i was in lock step with the whole big world.

driving to work, i can’t recall now whether i passed any cars or waited patiently behind the buses which stopped every few blocks. there wasn’t any parking near the lab, i crept along the blocks heading towards the hills, farther and farther from where i was trying to go, but it wasn’t a problem, maybe there’s something interesting down this lane, maybe not.

maybe it was the first day i got over the first girl i loved. maybe it was just that nothing occured to me to be bothered by. maybe there’s no rhyme or reason to anything like this anyway.

it started to drizzle when i crossed the boundary from broadway onto campus, i was wearing my thin blue cotton short sleeved button down, with the swirly dotted patterns, and worn blue jeans.

i wonder if that was the day i hung out with zoe at the trident, when we walked down alleyways and i took a picture of her in all black. man oh man, i forgot about that day.

i floated down to the station for lunch, which was two eggs and toast and hash browns and the worst quality sausages. but anyway it was only four dollars and somehow i wanted something with no character.

it felt like i could see all the patterns of my life unfold up to that point, and even though i knew it had to change going forward, the gradient of things was clearly obscured, like my skin and the wall from the morning sun.

can you imagine reading so quickly your eyes can’t keep up, you start imagining the story in your head, not bothering to look down at the page anymore, doing the writing yourself, and you wake up with drool on your chin, realizing it was only a dream. you want to go back in.

they always kept the physics department too cold in the summer. every day i would come in with my flip flops and light summer gear, and end up with goose bumps before the first morning meeting was over.

some code got written, some data taken, science progressed one iota because of me.

i dipped out to meet zoe, to do my radio show. to meet with aiko. who even knows.

the world feels so god damn warm and soft

item.title: friends
item.description:
the little imprints
left on the web
i see myself
on the surface of their skin
it honestly makes me
tear up in public

the little imprints
they honestly make me
want to do more
and write better

i wrote a letter yesterday
and used ancient texting
to send it across the street

this is a crazy place
i am a crazy place
only sometimes
but it’s okay to be crazy

sometimes
